subItems.text: Players and supporters recruited through the platform are permanently linked to the club responsible for onboarding them. Once a dynamic card is generated, the connection to the originating club cannot be altered.

Any recruitment fees or other revenues generated from the employment of these players or supporters will be allocated to the original club, both at the time of recruitment and for any future opportunities.
Players who currently represent a different club from the one responsible for their recruitment and training may have a dual club association. In such cases:

sub: The Main Club (responsible for recruitment and training) will receive all recruitment-related fees.
The Active Club (current representation) does not receive recruitment fees but benefits from increased player visibility.

subItems.text: This feature is under review and may be implemented in the future.
Clubs earn revenue based on successful hires of their Players or Supporters.
Revenue shares will be credited to the Club’s account monthly, subject to a minimum payout threshold of [Insert Amount].
Companies subscribing to the platform are directly associated with a specific club for the duration of their subscription. For instance:

sub: If Company A subscribes to the platform through Club B, a portion of the subscription fee will be distributed to Club B as a revenue share

subItems.text: Upon renewal, companies can choose to maintain their association with the same club or switch to a different club based on their preferences.

Large organizations operating in multiple locations or at a state/municipal level can purchase multiple contracts linked to different clubs. This enables them to support multiple clubs simultaneously, promoting equitable distribution of revenue.
Companies must pay subscription fees, job posting fees, or per-hire fees as applicable.
Fees are non-refundable except as required by law.
Clubs retain a permanent connection to players and supporters they onboard, ensuring continued revenue benefits for all future recruitments.
A dual club association feature may be introduced to benefit both the training club and the active club of a player.
Companies are directly linked to a club through their subscription, ensuring clubs receive a fair share of company fees.
Users are responsible for any taxes associated with payments or revenue earned through the Platform.
